formalText: She doesn't really know why things get so bad some days and not other days, and she doesn't have any way that she can make a difference.
She's also angry at everybody else who once they learn how to use these coping skills, that actually fixes things.
She's not sure if those people exist, but people certainly talk like those people.
She feels like she's been set up to believe that when these things fell for her,
that means that she's a failure.
She feels like she's failed, and she feels like there's something fundamentally wrong with her.
Like she's deformed in some way or something.
Undeserved suffering scares the shit out of people.
It scares her when she doesn't feel like she has done something to deserve what's happening to her.
She also doesn't want to be full of rage and exhausted by all these things.
Things have not been so hard the last couple days.
So that's good.

She likes saying when she does this, this results, and when she does this, this results, like what are the ways that she can change her environment to help her. Being angry about it gets to where it hurts her rather than helps her.

She's not very good at.
